snippet: International military officials are investigating two episodes  of civilian deaths in what appeared to be American-led military actions.
abstract: International military officials in Afghanistan are investigating two episodes near Pakistan border in which as many as 11 Afghan civilians may have been killed in what appear to be American-led military actions.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, and an employee of The New York Times from Kunar Province.

lead_paragraph: International military officials are investigating two episodes  of civilian deaths in what appeared to be American-led military actions.

headline.seo: International Military Officials Investigate Afghan Deaths
headline.main: 11 Afghans Killed in Military Actions Near Pakistan Border
headline.print_headline: 11 Afghans Killed in Military Actions Near Pakistan Border
